alert.note: Alert for Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 1:41PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...SERIES OF WINTER STORMS WILL BRING IMPACTS TO THE BASIN AND RANGE THROUGH NEXT WEEK... * Isolated snow showers will be possible early Sunday across the area. While accumulations should be minimal with 1 inch or less most areas, slick roadways will be possible during the morning hours. * A potent Atmospheric River is still expected to impact the area Monday into Tuesday. This system will bring copious amounts of moisture and precipitation to the region with good spillover expected. Light snowfall is likely Monday morning, potentially impacting the work commute. Snow levels are expected to rise Monday afternoon and evening before dropping again late Monday into Tuesday. The greatest snowfall accumulations outside of the higher terrain will be west of Highway 95 near Fernley, Silver Springs, and Nixon where up to 2 inches is possible. * While winds are not expected to cause major travel disruptions, gusty and choppy conditions will be possible on Pyramid Lake each day and boaters should exercise caution.

area.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
